someone please explain how the peering works in geth bootnodes
i started a geth node (lets call it Node A),  assigned its OWN enode address to its --bootnode parameter 
and then added a static peer to it
this works just fine, so the geth node who is supposed to be a bootnode, is now synced
NOW, i start another geth node (node B), with no peers whatsoever 
and give it the enode of Node A, as a boot node address
node B only discovers Node A as a peer
but node B does NOT discover the static peer of Node A, as an additional peer for itself
why is that?
am i missing something in how geth peering works?
or what the bootnode is supposed to do?
please, please explain and elaborate
